page.title: 03INTRODUCTION
page.content: There are two sub post offices including general stores and a further three shops in the district. Burrington village has no shops or pubs. There are two Primary schools in the area for children under eleven, at Burrington and at Churchill Gate. There is a large secondary school at the west end of Churchill village. The communities often provide their own entertainments.There are two parish halls and two parish churches. The people are friendly, helping to make it a pleasant area in which to live. House prices are regarded as being high. Old buildings have been bought up in the past and renovated. They are then regarded as being highly acceptable houses. Since they are expensive, the population is becoming more elderly.
